required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Toric Intraocular Lens (IOL) Implantation for Management of Cataracts
clinical_study.official_title: Plate-haptic Toric Intraocular Lens (IOL) Implantation for Management of Cataracts

lead_sponsor.agency: Eye & ENT Hospital of Fudan University

clinical_study.source: Eye & ENT Hospital of Fudan University

brief_summary.textblock: This study included cataract patients who underwent toric intraocular lens (IOL) implantation, which aimed to evaluate the stability and clinical visual quality of toric IOLs.

detailed_description.textblock: This study included cataract patients who underwent the implantation of toric intraocular lens (IOL) with haptic design, which aimed to evaluate the stability and clinical visual quality of toric IOLs.

primary_outcome.measure: IOL rotation degree at one hour
primary_outcome.description: After the pupil was dilated, the IOL axis was recorded using the same slit-lamp microscope. IOL rotation was defined as the difference between the target and final axis.

primary_outcome.description: After the pupil was dilated, the IOL axis was recorded using the same slit-lamp microscope. IOL rotation was defined as the difference between the target and final axis.

Decentration was defned as the distance between the center of the toric IOL and the visual axis and was calculated using Adobe Photoshop software on the retro image exported from the OPD-scan aberrometer.

arm_group.arm_group_label: cataract patients implanted with toric IOLs
arm_group.description: Cataract patients who received the implantation of different toric IOLs with different haptic designs

study_pop.textblock: Cataract patients who underwent uneventful lens phacoemulsification and toric IOL implantation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Cataract
Exclusion Criteria:
- â€¢ small pupil
- zonular dehiscence
- preexisting corneal pathology
- glaucoma
- uveitis
- a history of ocular trauma or surgery
- severe intraoperative and postoperative complications
